intro: Koechlea mitis, commonly known as the slender gray snail, is a species of air-breathing land snail. It belongs to the family Aegidriidae and is native to parts of Europe, including France, Italy, and Spain. The snail has a glossy, pale to grayish shell that is typically elongated and narrow. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forests and gardens. Its diet primarily consists of leaf litter and decaying plant matter, contributing to nutrient cycling in its ecosystem.
